intro: Ptarmica spinosa, commonly known as the prickly germander, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has serrated, hairy leaves and is often found in dry, rocky soils across Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 30 centimeters tall, with a creeping habit that allows it to spread along the ground. Ptarmica spinosa is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
